Trade/Device Name(s): BD PhoenixTM Automated Microbiology System - Penicillin (0.0156-32 μg/mL) EY
BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System for use with the antimicrobial agent penicillin (0.0156-32 μg/mL) - Streptococcus ID/AST or AST only Phoenix Panels
Regulation Name(s): Fully automated short-term incubation cycle antimicrobial susceptibility system
Specimen Type(s): Isolates from pure culture of aerobic and facultative anaerobic Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria
Streptococcus species (e.g., Beta hemolytic streptococci group ACG, Streptococcus agalactiae, Streptococcus viridans group, Streptococcus pneumoniae)
Method(s)/Technology(ies): Redox indicator for organism growth detection
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System penicillin susceptibility test panels for Streptococcus and other relevant Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria.
Indications for Use Summary: Intended for in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility (MIC) of pure culture isolates of most aerobic and facultative anaerobic Gram-negative bacteria and Gram-positive bacteria (Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, Streptococcus) using penicillin at 0.0156-32 μg/mL concentrations, via Streptococcus ID/AST or AST-only Phoenix panels.
